intro: Empogona filiformistipulata subsp. filiformistipulata, commonly known as the slender-stipule empogona, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated stipules that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and clustered, producing small, white or pale yellow fruits that are dispersed by animals.
